decks.notes: The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to aggressively play low-cost creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It relies on the synergy between creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Emberheart Challenger, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and push damage. The deck also includes card draw with Stormchaser's Talent and Stock Up, as well as some utility with Slickshot Show-Off and Experimental Synthesizer. The mana base is focused on helping cast spells efficiently to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. By using cheap creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger along with burn spells like Torch the Tower and Reckless Rage, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Soul-Scar Mage adds to the deck's versatility and ability to control the board. Additionally, the mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and quick aggression.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating advantage through card draw and resource denial. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra card advantage. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure consistent mana production and disruption with cards like Field of Ruin and Gloomlake Verge.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Emberheart Challenger to deal damage quickly, paired with burn spells like Fiery Impulse and Monstrous Rage to finish off opponents. The deck also takes advantage of spells like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to draw additional cards and maintain pressure on the opponent. By combining quick creatures with burn spells and card draw, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on casting low-cost creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing mana creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to ramp into powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition while controlling the opponent's board with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Collected Company provides additional creature selection and Boseiju, Who Endures offers protection against counterspells. The deck's strategy is to maintain a steady board presence and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive tactics with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards that bolster the power of creatures, provide card draw, and allow for flexibility in casting spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage. The deck also includes removal spells like Reckless Rage to control the board and ensure the opponent is unable to stabilize. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive and calculated play.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to utilize low-cost and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage, combined with burn spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage, to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and card selection spells like Stormchaser's Talent and Stock Up to maintain tempo and find the necessary threats or answers. The mana base consists of both red and blue dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells and putting pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own powerful threats like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. The inclusion of a companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides additional value and versatility to the deck. With a mix of counter magic, removal, and card draw, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and ultimately secure victory through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and board wipes like Vanishing Verse and High Noon. It also uses powerful creatures like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to control the battlefield. The deck has a mix of black, white, and red mana sources to support its varied spell requirements and aims to outvalue the opponent with its synergy between control elements and strong threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to outlast the opponent by managing threats efficiently and gradually gaining an advantage. The deck is built around Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion, providing additional value with creature spells. With a blend of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, the deck excels at dictating the pace of the game and outmaneuvering opponents with careful planning and resource management.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ouroboroid and Skyclave Apparition, along with disruptive spells like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Enduring Innocence. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

Using the power of flickering and blinking creatures, this Bant Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with tempo plays and disruptive effects. By utilizing cards like Charming Prince and Skyclave Apparition to repeatedly exile threats, combined with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Mistmoors to apply pressure, the deck seeks to control the board and push through damage quickly. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and card advantage, allowing for a more flexible and resilient game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and efficient creatures and spells, using a combination of prowess triggers and direct damage effects to quickly reduce their life total to zero. The deck focuses on maintaining a high level of aggression through cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, while also utilizing spells like Reckless Rage and Boomerang Basics to control the board and keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to quickly close out games by being proactive and utilizing its speed and versatility.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays by utilizing strong creatures and disruption spells. The deck focuses on efficient removal with Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Thoughtseize and Duress. Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide powerful creatures to apply pressure, supported by Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Preacher of the Schism and Fear of Missing Out to maintain board control and tempo advantage in the game.

The deck focuses on using Lotus Field as a key piece in a combo strategy to generate a large amount of mana quickly. By utilizing cards like Scapeshift, Lumra, Bellow of the Woods, and Stock Up, the deck aims to ramp up mana production to play powerful spells and win the game efficiently. The deck also includes cards like The Wandering Minstrel and Arboreal Grazer to help set up the combo pieces and protect against disruption. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the right pieces to generate enough mana to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively attack your opponent using creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also disrupting their game plan with spells like Reckless Rage and Academic Dispute. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent by quickly deploying threats and using burn spells to finish them off. The inclusion of cards like Riverpyre Verge and Stock Up helps to ensure a steady stream of cards and resources to keep the aggression going. The deck focuses on quick and explosive plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.
